results.title: Clay in action
results.brief_description: Step-by-step demonstrations of a sculptor modelling a head in clay. Shows how he packs clay on wooden supports; the first rough carving; measuring the model with calipers and cutting the measurements into the clay, carving out the larger primary, carving out minor planes; using the thumbs to blend, model and smooth; finishing.
results.description: Step-by-step demonstrations of a sculptor modelling a head in clay. results.title: Clay and water
results.brief_description: In the republic of Mali, in West Africa, traditional architecture is perfectly adapted to climatic conditions and local resources. Houses, monuments and mosques built of clay and earth - some of which have stood for centuries - correspond to the needs of the inhabitants, and show the creative use of materials given to them by nature.

results.title: Claus Bury, landscape sculpture
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Crafts Council of Australia and Crafts Resource Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows Claus Bury, a German sculptor and jeweller, working with Australian tertiary sculpture students in workshop situations. The film looks in particular at his work in outdoor environments. Music by Geoffrey d’Ombrain and camera and editing by David Corke

results.title: The Classroom
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children. Sebastian the Fox appears in a typical classroom with children playing pranks on their master as well as on each other. As so often happens the innocent are punished, in this case Sebastian. The offenders are eventually caught and receive their just desserts.

results.title: Classic old, exciting new
results.brief_description: This film shows the work of the Australian Museum’s many sections - the storage facilities, the maintenance necessary, the preparation of exhibits and the research and publications sections. All are of vital importance to the preservation of our Australian heritage.

results.title: A Class of your own (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Need, John R.F. Stewart and Stewart Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instructional Techniques”.
Primarily designed for the instruction of the services, this film puts forward principles that are equally applicable to teaching in the civilian field. The instructor must plan their lessons in advance, whether in the classroom or at the workbench. The lesson should have a proper introduction, be developed logically, and flow naturally and interestingly to its concluding summary. The value of class activity, teaching aids, planned questions and proper note-taking are all dealt with in this film. The film falls into two parts: classroom instruction and practical instruction.

results.title: Clash of opinion
results.creator_credit: Margaret Smith, Gregory Clegg and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Discusses the role of personnel management in industrial disputes. A dispute between management and members of a Transport Union is examined. A panel of directors of companies, trade unionists and personnel managers give opinions of how the dispute arose. Stresses the need for good communications between employers and unions and better education on negotiation for shop stewards. A good personnel manager can play an important day to day role in the creation of good relations between workers and management over a long period.

results.title: The Clarinet. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, EFVA and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
Jack Brymer of the BBC Symphony Orchestra talks about the history of the clarinet. He demonstrates all the instruments which form the clarinet family, from the high E flat to the contra bass, showing how they work and how to play them. Director Muir Mathieson was music director/composer for Sir Alexander Korda’s London films in the 1930s and 1940s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Muir Mathieson, Ken Cameron, EFVA and World Mirror-Realist Films
